findings.title: Skill does not specify a license
findings.description: Skill manifest does not include a 'license' field. Specifying a license helps users understand usage terms.
findings.remediation: Add 'license' field to SKILL.md frontmatter (e.g., MIT, Apache-2.0)

findings.title: Missing Optional Metadata Fields
findings.description: The skill manifest is missing optional metadata fields including 'license', 'compatibility', and 'allowed-tools'. While these fields are optional per the agent skills specification, their absence makes it harder to assess the skill's intended usage constraints and compatibility requirements.
findings.snippet: YAML frontmatter missing: license, compatibility, allowed-tools fields
findings.remediation: Add optional metadata fields to improve transparency: specify license (e.g., Apache-2.0), compatibility (e.g., 'Works in Claude.ai, Claude Code, API'), and allowed-tools (e.g., [Read, Bash, Python]) to clarify intended tool usage.

metadata.overall_assessment: This skill is SAFE for use. It provides educational documentation about OSS-Fuzz, Google's continuous fuzzing infrastructure for open-source projects. The skill contains only markdown documentation with no executable code, no network calls, no data exfiltration, and no prompt injection attempts. It serves as a reference guide for developers who want to use OSS-Fuzz for fuzzing their projects. The only minor issues are missing optional metadata fields and references to external example files that are not included in the package. These are informational concerns that do not pose security risks.

findings.title: Referenced Files Not Found in Package
findings.description: The skill instructions reference four Python files (atheris.py, fuzzing.py, cbor2.py, specific.py) that are not included in the skill package. These appear to be example harness files from OSS-Fuzz documentation. While not a direct security threat, missing referenced files could cause confusion or errors if users expect these files to be present.
findings.snippet: Referenced files not found: atheris.py, fuzzing.py, cbor2.py, specific.py
findings.remediation: Either include the referenced example files in the skill package, or clarify in the documentation that these are external examples from OSS-Fuzz projects that users should reference from the official OSS-Fuzz repository.

metadata.overall_assessment: This skill is SAFE for use. It provides educational documentation about OSS-Fuzz, Google's continuous fuzzing infrastructure for open-source projects. The skill contains only markdown documentation with no executable code, no network calls, no data exfiltration, and no prompt injection attempts. It serves as a reference guide for developers who want to use OSS-Fuzz for fuzzing their projects. The only minor issues are missing optional metadata fields and references to external example files that are not included in the package. These are informational concerns that do not pose security risks.
